00035 #include <assert.h>
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <stdint.h>
00038 #include <string.h>
00039 #include <unistd.h>
00040 #include "cparser.h"
00041 #include "cparser_priv.h"
00042 #include "cparser_token.h"
00043 #include "cparser_tree.h"
00044 
00046 #define BZERO_OUTPUT memset(output, 0, sizeof(output)); output_ptr = output
00047 
00048 extern char output[2000], *output_ptr;
00049 extern int interactive;
00050 int num_passed = 0, num_failed =0;
00051 
00055 static void
00056 feed_parser (cparser_t *parser, const char *str)
00057 {
00058     int m, n;
00059     m = strlen(str);
00060     for (n = 0; n < m; n++) {
00061         cparser_input(parser, str[n], CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00068 static void
00069 update_result (char *got, const char *expected, const char *test)
00070 {
00071     int failed, n;
00072 
00073     failed = strcmp(got, expected);
00074     if (failed) {
00075         for (n = 0; n < strlen(expected); n++) {
00076             if (got[n] != expected[n]) {
00077                 printf("Index %d: expected=%c  got=%c\n", n, expected[n], 
00078                        got[n]);
00079             }
00080         }
00081     }
00082     if (!failed) {
00083         printf("\nPASS: %s\n", test);
00084         num_passed++;
00085     } else {
00086         printf("\nFAIL: %s\n", test);
00087         num_failed++;
00088     }
00089     fflush(stdout);
00090 }
00091 
00092 static void
00093 test_printc (const cparser_t *parser, const char ch)
00094 {
00095     output_ptr += sprintf(output_ptr, "%c", ch);
00096 }
00097 
00098 static void
00099 test_prints (const cparser_t *parser, const char *s)
00100 {
00101     output_ptr += sprintf(output_ptr, "%s", s);
00102 }
00103 
00112 int
00113 main (int argc, char *argv[])
00114 {
00115     cparser_t parser;
00116     char *config_file = NULL;
00117     int ch, debug = 0, n;
00118     cparser_result_t rc;
00119 
00120     memset(&parser, 0, sizeof(parser));
00121 
00122     while (-1 != (ch = getopt(argc, argv, "pic:d"))) {
00123         switch (ch) {
00124             case 'p':
00125                 printf("pid = %d\n", getpid());
00126                 break;
00127             case 'i':
00128                 interactive = 1;
00129                 break;
00130             case 'c':
00131                 config_file = optarg;
00132                 break;
00133             case 'd':
00134                 debug = 1;
00135                 break;
00136         }
00137     }
00138 
00139     parser.cfg.root = &cparser_root;
00140     parser.cfg.ch_complete = '\t';
00141     /* 
00142      * Instead of making sure the terminal setting of the target and 
00143      * the host are the same. ch_erase and ch_del both are treated
00144      * as backspace.
00145      */
00146     parser.cfg.ch_erase = '\b';
00147     parser.cfg.ch_del = 127;
00148     parser.cfg.ch_help = '?';
00149     parser.cfg.flags = (debug ? CPARSER_FLAGS_DEBUG : 0);
00150     strcpy(parser.cfg.prompt, "TEST>> ");
00151     parser.cfg.fd = STDOUT_FILENO;
00152     cparser_io_config(&parser);
00153 
00154     if (CPARSER_OK != cparser_init(&parser.cfg, &parser)) {
00155         printf("Fail to initialize parser.\n");
00156     return -1;
00157     }
00158     if (interactive) {
00159         if (config_file) {
00160             (void)cparser_load_cmd(&parser, config_file);
00161         }
00162         cparser_run(&parser);
00163     } else {
00164         /* Run the scripted tests */
00165         /* Test command execution without trailing space */
00166         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00167         feed_parser(&parser, "show employees\n");
00168         update_result(output, "No employee in the roster.\n",
00169                       "command without trailing space");
00170 
00171         /* Test command execution with trailing space */
00172         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00173         feed_parser(&parser, "show employees \n");
00174         update_result(output, "No employee in the roster.\n",
00175                       "command with trailing space");
00176 
00177         /* Test 'shortest unique keyword' without trailing space  */
00178         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00179         feed_parser(&parser, "sh employees a\n");
00180         update_result(output, "No employee in the roster.\n",
00181                       "shortest unique keyword without trailing space");
00182 
00183         /* Test 'shortest unique keyword' with trailing space */
00184         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00185         feed_parser(&parser, "sh employees a \n");
00186         update_result(output, "No employee in the roster.\n",
00187                       "shortest unique keyword with trailing space");
00188 
00189         /* Test command completion */
00190         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00191         feed_parser(&parser, "sh\temp\ts a\t\n");
00192         update_result(output, "No employee in the roster.\n",
00193                       "command completion");
00194 
00195         /* Test cparser_submode_enter() and cparse_submode_exit() */
00196         feed_parser(&parser, "employee 0x1\n");
00197         feed_parser(&parser, "name bob\n");
00198         feed_parser(&parser, "date-of-birth 11 1 1970\n");
00199         feed_parser(&parser, "height 70\n");
00200         feed_parser(&parser, "weight 165\n");
00201         feed_parser(&parser, "exit\n");
00202 
00203         feed_parser(&parser, "employee 0x3\n");
00204         feed_parser(&parser, "name john\n");
00205         feed_parser(&parser, "date-of-birth 8 17 1959\n");
00206         feed_parser(&parser, "height 80\n");
00207         feed_parser(&parser, "weight 220\n");
00208         feed_parser(&parser, "exit\n");
00209 
00210         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00211         feed_parser(&parser, "show employees-by-id 0x0 0x1\n");
00212         update_result(output, 
00213                       "bob\n   ID: 0x00000001\n   Height:  70\"   Weight: 165 lbs.\n", 
00214                       "prefixing commands");
00215         
00216         /* Test optional parameters */
00217         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00218         feed_parser(&parser, "show employees-by-id 0x0\n");
00219         update_result(output, 
00220                       "bob\n   ID: 0x00000001\n   Height:  70\"   Weight: 165 lbs.\n" 
00221                       "john\n   ID: 0x00000003\n   Height:  80\"   Weight: 220 lbs.\n",
00222                       "optional parameter");
00223 
00224         /* Test the left arrow key */
00225         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00226         feed_parser(&parser, "shaw employees-by-id 0x0");
00227         for (n = 0; n < 20; n++) {
00228             rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW);
00229             if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00230                 break;
00231             }
00232         }
00233         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00234             feed_parser(&parser, "\b\bow\n");
00235             update_result(output, 
00236                           "bob\n   ID: 0x00000001\n   Height:  70\"   Weight: 165 lbs.\n" 
00237                           "john\n   ID: 0x00000003\n   Height:  80\"   Weight: 220 lbs.\n",
00238                           "left arrow #1");
00239         } else {
00240             printf("\nFAIL: left arrow #1\n");
00241             fflush(stdout);
00242             num_failed++;
00243         }
00244 
00245         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00246         for (n = 0; n < 10; n++) {
00247             rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW);
00248             if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00249                 break;
00250             }
00251         }
00252         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00253             feed_parser(&parser, "\n");
00254             update_result(output, "", "left arrow #2");
00255         } else {
00256             printf("\nFAIL: left arrow #2\n");
00257             fflush(stdout);
00258             num_failed++;
00259         }
00260         
00261         /* Test right arrow key */
00262         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00263         feed_parser(&parser, "shaw employees-by-id 0x0");
00264         for (n = 0; n < 20; n++) {
00265             rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW);
00266             if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00267                 break;
00268             }
00269         }
00270         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00271             feed_parser(&parser, "\b\bow");
00272             for (n = 0; n < 20; n++) {
00273                 rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_RIGHT_ARROW);
00274                 if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00275                     break;
00276                 }
00277             }
00278         } else {
00279             printf("\nFAIL: left arrow #1\n");
00280             num_failed++;
00281         }
00282         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00283             feed_parser(&parser, " 0x1\n");
00284             update_result(output, 
00285                       "bob\n   ID: 0x00000001\n   Height:  70\"   Weight: 165 lbs.\n", 
00286                       "right arrow #1");
00287         }
00288 
00289         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00290         feed_parser(&parser, "show employees-by-id 0x2");
00291         for (n = 0; n < 20; n++) {
00292             rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW);
00293             if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00294                 break;
00295             }
00296         }
00297         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00298             for (n = 0; n < 5; n++) {
00299                 rc = cparser_input(&parser, 0, CPARSER_CHAR_RIGHT_ARROW);
00300                 if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00301                     break;
00302                 }
00303             }
00304         } else {
00305             printf("\nFAIL: right arrow #2\n");
00306             num_failed++;
00307         }
00308         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00309             feed_parser(&parser, "\n");
00310             update_result(output, 
00311                           "john\n   ID: 0x00000003\n   Height:  80\"   Weight: 220 lbs.\n",
00312                           "right arrow #2");
00313         }
00314 
00315         /* Test context-sensitive help */
00316         parser.cfg.printc = test_printc;
00317         parser.cfg.prints = test_prints;
00318 
00319         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00320         feed_parser(&parser, "s?");
00321         update_result(output, "s\nshow\nsave\nTEST>> s", 
00322                       "context-sensitive help #1");
00323 
00324         /* Reset the output buffer */
00325         feed_parser(&parser, "\n");
00326         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00327 
00328         feed_parser(&parser, "s\t");
00329         update_result(output, "s\nshow\nsave\nTEST>> s", 
00330                       "context-sensitive help #2");
00331 
00332         /* Test incomplete commands */
00333         feed_parser(&parser, "\n"); /* flush out the last incomplete command */
00334         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00335         feed_parser(&parser, "s\n");
00336         update_result(output, "s\n        ^Incomplete command\nTEST>> ",
00337                       "Incomplete command #1");
00338 
00339         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00340         feed_parser(&parser, "show \n");
00341         update_result(output, 
00342                       "show \n            ^Incomplete command\nTEST>> ",
00343                       "Incomplete command #2");
00344 
00345         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00346         feed_parser(&parser, "show em\n");
00347         update_result(output, 
00348                       "show em\n              ^Incomplete command\nTEST>> ",
00349                       "Incomplete command #3");
00350 
00351         /* Test invalid commands */
00352         feed_parser(&parser, "\n"); /* flush out the last incomplete command */
00353         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00354         feed_parser(&parser, "xyz\n");
00355         update_result(output, "xyz\n       ^Parse error\nTEST>> ",
00356                       "Invalid command #1");
00357 
00358         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00359         feed_parser(&parser, "show xyz\n");
00360         update_result(output, "show xyz\n            ^Parse error\nTEST>> ",
00361                       "Invalid command #2");
00362         
00363         /* 
00364          * Test cparser_help_cmd() with and without a filter string.
00365          * This implicitly tests cparser_walk() as well.
00366          */
00367         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00368         feed_parser(&parser, "help\n");
00369         update_result(output, "help \n"
00370                       "List a summary of employees.\r\n  show employees \r\n\n"
00371                       "List detail records of all employees.\r\n  show employees all \r\n\n"
00372                       "List all employees within a certain range of employee ids\r\n  show employees-by-id { <UINT:min> { <UINT:max> } } \r\n\n"
00373                       "Show specific field of an employee.\r\n  show employee <HEX:id> [ height | weight | date-of-birth | title ] \r\n\n"
00374                       "Add a new employee or enter the record of an existing employee\r\n  employee <HEX:id> \r\n\n"
00375                       "Delete an existing employee\r\n  no employee <HEX:id> \r\n\n"
00376                       "Save the current roster to a file\r\n  save roster <STRING:filename> \r\n\n"
00377                       "Load roster file\r\n  load roster <FILE:filename> \r\n\n"
00378                       "List all available commands with a substring 'filter' in it.\r\n  help { <STRING:filter> } \r\n\n"
00379                       "Enable privileged mode\r\n  enable privileged-mode \r\n\n"
00380                       "Leave the database\r\n  quit \r\n\n"
00381                       "TEST>> ",
00382                       "help summary #1");
00383 
00384         BZERO_OUTPUT;
00385         feed_parser(&parser, "help roster\n");
00386         update_result(output, "help roster \n"
00387                       "Save the current roster to a file\r\n  save roster <STRING:filename> \r\n\n"
00388                       "Load roster file\r\n  load roster <FILE:filename> \r\n\n"
00389                       "TEST>> ",
00390                       "help summary #2");
00391 
00392         printf("Total=%d  Passed=%d  Failed=%d\n", num_passed + num_failed,
00393                num_passed, num_failed);
00394     }
00395     return 0;
00396 }
